intro: Agyneia hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy agyneia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which provide a distinctive texture. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. It is native to certain regions of southern Africa and thrives in dry, rocky habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
